intro: Schizocalyx condoricus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hakea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, often aromatic foliage. The plant typically has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pink. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Schizocalyx condoricus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
